text: Lee Eun-kyung (born 1 February 1961) is a South Korean female volleyball player and coach. She was part of the South Korea women's national volleyball team at the 1984 Summer Olympic Games. Lee attended in Busan. She represented her school at the 10th President's Cup Volleyball Championships in Gwangju in 1975 and in the high school division of the 33rd National Men's and Women's Classified Volleyball Championships in Daejeon in 1978. After her graduation in 1978, she played for Hyundai. The Korea Corporate Volleyball Federation; homepage honoured her with its Player of the Year Award in 1981. == Notes == == References == Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:South Korean women's volleyball players Category:Volleyball players at the 1984 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic volleyball players of South Korea Category:Volleyball players at the 1982 Asian Games Category:Volleyball players at the 1986 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in volleyball Category:Asian Games bronze medalists for South Korea Category:Medalists at the 1982 Asian Games Category:Medalists at the 1986 Asian Games
title: Lee Eun-kyung (volleyball)
